A group of young people in Vazhapadi did a worthy thing on the even or Martyrs Day. They cleaned the statues of B. R. Ambedkar, Indira Gandhi and M. G. Ramachandran located at the Vazhapadi bus stand. The young volunteers were from the Nehru Yuva Kendra and Ilaignar Manram led by Periyar Mannan, coordinator of the Vazhapadi Periyar Training Centre. Later they paid floral tributes to the statues.

Devotees hailing from Edapadi and the surrounding villages distributed a record twenty tonnes of Panchamirtham in connection with the Thaipoosam festival at the Arulmigu Murugan Temple in Palani. The members of the Paruvatha Rajakula Kavadi Kuzhu of Edapadi annually take out a pada yathra to Palani Temple during the Thaipoosam festival days. They have been doing this for decades. The Paruvatha Rajakula Kavadi Kuzhu comprised of a special sub-team with members who were experts in preparing Panchamirtham. The team members made twenty tonnes of Panchamirtham using 10 tonnes of plantains, two tonnes of sugar, 2,400 kg of dates, 1,000 kg of rock candy, 240 kg of honey, 30 kg of cardamom, etc.

There were some tense moments at the farmers grievances day meeting held at the collectorate in Namakkal recently. Two groups of farmers clashed over a difference of opinion between Senthai Thangam and Sundaram. Following a wordy duel between both, Mr. Sundaram walked out. However, the officials pacified him, andhe returned to the meeting. V. Dakshinamoorthy, District Collector, who presided over the meeting said that henceforth only genuine farmers will be allowed to participate in the meeting and raise issues pertinent to the farming community.

(Reporting by

Syed Muthahar Saqaf)
title: An exemplary act
